thread.title: Man beaten by group armed with bats covered in nails at Bondi Beach - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Man beaten by group armed with bats covered in nails at Bondi Beach - Yahoo7

author: News On February
title: Man beaten by group armed with bats covered in nails at Bondi Beach - Yahoo7
text:
Share Man beaten by group armed with bats covered in nails at Bondi Beach - Yahoo7 A man has been savagely beaten by several men armed with iron bars and baseball bats with nails in the end at the northern end of Bondi Beach. Close Man attacked at north Bondi UP NEXT VIDEO Man attacked at north Bondi 
Police have cordoned off the area near the beach while the 34-year-old man man has been rushed to St Vincent's hospital with serious facial injuries. 
Witnesses claim that three man set upon the victim armed with an axe and a bat, leaving him bloodied just next to the iconic beach. 
The attackers were seen fleeing the scene in a white Mercedes. A man is being treated by paramedics just next to Bondi Beach after a brutal attack on Thursday afternoon. Source: 7 News One man could be seen clutching at his face. Source: Facebook 
"Shortly after 1pm (Thursday 16 February 2017) a man suffered injuries after he was assaulted by a group of men," NSW Police said in a statement. 
Lia Trebilcock witnessed the ordeal and said the attackers were wielding “bats that had nails in the end”. 
“The person I treated had severe injuries," she wrote. 
"This happened in broad daylight on a beautiful Bondi day. 
"Seriously what is going on in the world?" The injured man was taken to St Vincent's Hospital with serious facial injuries. Source: 7 News Witness Lia Trebilcock said the men were wielding bats with nails in the end. Source: Facebook 
Police are urging anyone with information in relation to this incident to call Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or use the Crime Stoppers online reporting page: https://nsw.crimestoppers.com.au/
